data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve a specific concept by type and name
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves detailed information about a specific concept from The New York Times controlled vocabulary by its type and name. Accepts a concept type (e.g., person, place, organization) and a specific concept name as path parameters. Returns the complete concept object including metadata, relationships to related concepts, and external semantic mappings. This operation is useful for looking up detailed information about a known Times Tag or Topic.
data.reasoning: Both summary and description are empty, making this operation completely opaque to AI agents. Added clear action verb, explained the purpose within the Semantic API domain, specified input parameters (concept-type and specific-concept), described the return value (concept object with relationships and mappings), and provided context about when to use this operation (known concept lookup).

Both summary and description are empty, providing no guidance for AI agents. Added action-oriented summary with domain context, explained the search functionality across the controlled vocabulary, specified that it returns multiple concept objects, and clarified the use case (discovery of Times Tags/Topics for article exploration). This helps AI agents understand when to use search versus direct name lookup.

data.summary_suggestion: Search for concepts in the controlled vocabulary
data.description_suggestion: Searches The New York Times controlled vocabulary for concepts matching specified query criteria. Accepts search parameters to filter and discover concepts (people, places, organizations, and other entities). Returns a collection of matching concept objects with their metadata and relationships. This operation enables discovery of relevant Times Tags and Topics that can be used to explore related articles or understand the semantic structure of the Times vocabulary.
